TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Everything's Shaping Up" Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n8f2vd1PEB1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Quite a lot of stuff done this week. Experimentals is moving along at a good pace, many bugs found and squished so far, but even more valuable this time was the excellent feedback the experimental team is giving us. TheyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re going out of their way to help us tune the hundreds of variables that affect Contracts and Currencies, so hereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a big thanks already for all the effort theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re putting into helping us finish up this release. About the specifics of what weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve done so far, the list is too big for a dev blog. Stay tuned for an update article soon.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA):</strong> </span><span>Last week I set the Independence Day Sale in the KSP Store for the weekend, it was a good one. Right now IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m doing some reports for the accounting department and then IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll keep adding the new part sounds. I know, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working on that for a long time, but every week something has to be done here at the office.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> The experimentals continue so have been squashing bugs and tweaking. Have also done some optimization work on some shaders to gain a little more overhead. Works out at around 8% for KerbinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s main shader which isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t too shabby.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Working with Max on the edition of a new gameplay video for First Contract. And moving on to new tasks, time to start a new Kerbal story, probably in space. </span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Between the tweaking and bugfixing last week i had time to create a new type of gui window that can be resized with the mouse. And now iÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m two days into my one week holiday.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps):</strong> </span><span>Mostly working on the video preview for First Contract. Also trying to show extra love to all of our off site communities as well as organizing our by now traditional media group videos. </span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker):</strong><span> Getting ready for First Contract to go live soon but in the meantime, was really stoked to see this </span><span>Le Monde</span><span> feature on </span><span>Kerbal Space Program</span><span> go live: </span><strong><a href="http://goo.gl/KF4FNb">http://goo.gl/KF4FNb</a></strong><span>. If you read French, please feel free to let us know what you think, or if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re like me, use Google Translate to get the gist of it. We are trying to get ready for the upcoming launch, which means we want to release screenshots, details on the update, a walkthrough video (thanks Max!) and of course an animation video. Ideally, we can coordinate all of this so it is seen by both our community and draws interest from gaming media which covers </span><span>KSP</span><span>. Also, a big shout out to the Reddit community, who has now put Buzz Aldrin on record that heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll check out </span><span>KSP</span><span>: </span><strong><a href="http://goo.gl/ezMiY7">http://goo.gl/ezMiY7</a></strong><span>. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s pretty cool. </span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted): </strong><span>I’ve been very busy this past week with the QA and Experimental Team. We’ve finished up QA on Hugo’s branch with the first build of it in Experimentals running as of writing this.</span></p>

<p><span>In Experimentals we’ve been going over the balance pass that Felipe and Mike worked on last week, as well as running through some of the more minor, but pretty significant, additions that were made in the interest of balance. We’ve also managed to narrow down and crush a few issues that were being very disruptive and not at all friendly. Lastly, we’ve been ensuring that some issues with the Launcher are all fixed across all platforms and it’s handling everything smoothly.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> While again, Ted’s devnote puts mine to shame, I can share that you’ll be seeing a First Contract FAQ soon. Are there any specific questions you’d like us to answer?<br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Eduardo (Lalo): </strong><span>Diagramming processes!!! Everything that can be measured, can be improved!!!</span></p>

<p><strong>Rogelio (Roger):</strong><span> Working on a new story along with Dan, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been discussing about the main theme and how we will tell it. Finally weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re <strong>done with the .24 animation </strong></span></p>

<p><strong>Hugo (The Intern): </strong><span>Working on the Mk series pieces. Starting some IVA planning for some of these. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been improving some of the MK-1 changes I did with the feedback of my coworkers. Getting super excited about the coming release. </span></p>
Mk2 cockpit internals! Please! It's been in since 0.15, in 2012, and its my favourite cockpit.
So the planes are finally getting an art pass? About time.

So the planes are finally getting an art pass? About time.

Agreed! Can't wait to see what they end up doing with the mk3 stuff...

TL-DR version:

We're working on the coming version to be released SOON!

Bob (Calisker): Getting ready for First Contract to go live soon but in the meantime, was really stoked to see this Le Monde feature on Kerbal Space Program go live: http://goo.gl/KF4FNb. If you read French, please feel free to let us know what you think, or if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re like me, use Google Translate to get the gist of it. We are trying to get ready for the upcoming launch, which means we want to release screenshots, details on the update, a walkthrough video (thanks Max!) and of course an animation video. Ideally, we can coordinate all of this so it is seen by both our community and draws interest from gaming media which covers KSP. Also, a big shout out to the Reddit community, who has now put Buzz Aldrin on record that heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll check out KSP: http://goo.gl/ezMiY7. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s pretty cool.

SoonÃ¢â€žÂ¢? Oh no...

D-Did... I just read.... That new IVAs is a thing?!

FINALLY

I can share that youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be seeing a First Contract FAQ soon. Are there any specific questions youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like us to answer?

Felipe (HarvesteR) said:

TheyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re going out of their way to help us tune the hundreds of variables that affect Contracts and Currencies

Could you share some of the variables? And/or tell us why "Currency" is plural?

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> While again, TedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s devnote puts mine to shame, I can share that youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be seeing a First Contract FAQ soon. Are there any specific questions youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like us to answer?<br/></span></p>

You asked

  1. Will 0.24 break career saves?
  2. Will 0.24 have any new biomes? If so, which planets got the treatment?
  3. Will 0.24 have any new parts?

That's what I got off the top of my head And be glad I layed off contracts. I thought of adding "Detail exactly how the contract process will work." but I'm not mean...

...though if you want to answer that...
Is it completely impossible to think that .24 will come out on the anniversary of the moon landing? July 20th?

Mhm, nice to hear that Hugo. I guess you're also re-shaping some of the Mk series' models, right? Like, the Mk3 cockpit for example, that thing really needed an art pass

Also, new IVAs for the cockpits which still lack it, the community will appreciate it!

Can't wait to see Hugo's take on the spaceplanes parts, they really needed some re-work I'll gladly read the whole article on Le Monde, tomorrow.

Btw, 0.24 seems to be shaping up greatly.

Question:

Will modders be able to dig into the contract system and even add new objectives?
For the FAQ: What would happen if you ran out of money in career mode? Do you get a game over screen or something?

From this, I can narrow down my release prediction to this week, and if not, almost certainly next week. That's as much speculation as I'll get into that. Really looking good guys! I'll bet KSP will feel like a different game after this. I'd buy it a second time if I wanted to (and had the money)!

My question for the FAQ would be: will there be difficulty/challenge level options when starting a new Career mode save in First Contract? Say, for example, I want to start with half (or a quarter) as much as the pre-set starting funds, or twice as much; will that be doable?

Will contracts make space stations more meaningful?

Will contracts make unmanned probes more meaningful?

-Khorso
Just so you all don't miss it, HarvesteR popped into /r/kerbalspaceprogram to answer a quick QUESTION.
Prepare yourselves! 0.24 is coming!
July 20th would be fitting.

Just so you all don't miss it, HarvesteR popped into /r/kerbalspaceprogram to answer a quick QUESTION.

Excellent, thanks for the tip. Sounds great! I think the follow-up question asked on Reddit is particularly relevant for the FAQ:

Are there a finite number of specifically designed contracts to work through, or are the contracts procedurally generated - at least after a certain point in the game?

It would seem ideal to have infinite randomly generated contracts at least following your completion of all the set contracts, so you don't hit a point where there's suddenly "nothing to do".

Looking forward to 0.24!

Edited July 9, 2014 by Kerano

Is it completely impossible to think that .24 will come out on the anniversary of the moon landing? July 20th?

wooot ! forty-five years !!
I dont want to wait that long.

I dont want to wait that long.

I know me neither!!!
Probably a dumb question, but might we be getting a surprise planet in .24?
